intro: Beilschmiedia rufolanata, commonly known as the red-veined beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves with prominent red veins. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark purple berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
